alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 10:27PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Henry, south central Clay and northwestern Early Counties through 1230 AM EDT/1130 PM CDT/... At 1127 PM EDT/1027 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Blakely. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blakely, Haleburg, Shorterville, Barnes, Ferrell Crossroads, Early Co A/p, Hayes, Kolomoki Mounds Sp and Rock Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee.
